  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23823].

Steps to reproduce: 

# create a table
# inside a cell, create a bullet (press the toolbar button)
# press backspace

You won't be able to backspace remove this bullet.
fields.summary: Can't delete first bullet in table cell on webkit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23822].
  {panel}

Confluence administration allows you to create a user without an email address.
When you attempt to share a page with a user that doesn't have an email address, you get the feedback below.
!111110_vagueFeedback.png!

I am not sure if the problem here is
* the vague error message
* the fact that we can create a user without an email address (and that when you edit the user, email address is a mandatory field)

h5. Reproduced on
h6. Environment
Stable
h6. Browser
IE8
IE9
FF7
Chrome
fields.summary: Vague feedback when attempting to send email who does not have an email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23821].
  {panel}

When user attempts to share a page with another user, the display picture of the sharee (?) is not rendered.

These users had the default display picture

This issue may exist in IE8 but investigation is blocked by [CONF-23819|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23819]
*In IE9*
!111110_displayPicNotShown.png!
*In FF7
!111110_noDisplayPicInFF.png!
fields.summary: Display pics do not render on Share Button for FF7 or IE9
On blog posts the created date should be shown

# click Share Button
# Invoke autocomplete by typing two letters

The following js error is thrown (even if the name / email address is valid)

fields.description: Anonymous user can open labels dialog i.e. anonymous can see a pencil icon. This is a bug. Anonymous user doesn't have to see this dialog. When anonymous user try to remove or add a new label nothing happens. It is correct, but in the version 3.5.13 anonymous user can not see pencil icon to edit labels.

h2. Workaround

The workaround for this issue is to rename it directly from the database. You could do it by executing this SQL query

{code:SQL}
UPDATE spaces SET spacename='<your preferred name'> WHERE spacekey='ds';
{code}

WikiToXhtmlMigrator incorrectly treats Windows file paths as space keys when migrating embedded resources

fields.description:
Inserted the following link into a document: http://example/tools/frog/cgi-bin/Query.cgi?ConnectionType=ConfigHosts;Env=MyDB;txtHost=;Host=Pgw0Host;Characterset=;Sql=select+*+from+MY_STATUS_HIST_0+where+rownum+<+10;Action=Query

Link appears in the wiki page with underlines and link color, but does not resolve in wiki page. Viewing HTML source in browser shows that link tag contains rel="nofollow". Works the same in wiki if inserted via Link icon or Insert > Link.
fields.summary: SQL query inserted as link renders as rel="nofollow" in browser page

fields.description:
In the footer the following links are dead:

* Atlassian News: 500 Internal Server error
* Enterprise Wiki: 404 "Oops you found a dead link"

I can see this happening in 3 separate instances (separate in terms of hardware and environments, but all 3.5.13).
fields.summary: Footer links are dead links

fields.description: A German colleague mentioned me on a Confluence page and the notification I received was in German instead of English.
fields.summary: Mention Notifications are in language of sender

fields.description:
Situation:
1. Create mail server, leave default From: field (${fullname} (Confluence) )
2. Create a user, set him to have daily digest mail notification.
3. Make a change
4. Scheduled Jobs> Run "Email Daily Reports"

Expected behavior:
Created user receives an email from (Confluence)

Actual behavior:
Created user recieves an email from Anonymous (Confluence)

Reason:
${fullname} resolves to Anonymous when null.

Reason it's problematic:
Many mail filters will filter as spam when from is Anonymous.

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When a user that has not logged in try to access a page that has certain special characters (in this case the character 'ę'), after logging in, the encoding of the URL where the character is positioned will be distorted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page that has the special character 'ę' and save it
!Wstęp 1.png|thumbnail!
# Copy the direct URL for the page (example : "http://localhost:8403/display/tst/Wstęp") and then log out.
# Paste the URL into your browser (it'll look like this now : "http://localhost:8403/display/tst/Wst%C4%99p")
!Wstęp 2.png|thumbnail!
# Log in, and Confluence will tell you that the page is not found. The address bar shows : "http://localhost:8403/display/tst/Wstp")
!Wstęp 3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Findings

I have tested this in Confluence 4.0.3, 4.0, 3.5.6. 

My database encoding is set to UTF-8. In my {{server.xml}}, the "URIEncoding" is also set to UTF-8.
fields.summary: Problem with URL encoding

fields.description:
h3.Expected Behavior:
When viewing a page in Confluence that is SSL'ed, the content should be fully encrypted, see the URL of the screenshot below:
!ssl3.jpg!

h3.Observed Behavior
A page that contains the View PDF Macro will break the SSL encryption for the whole content.

h3.Cause
When the View PDF Macro is attached, there is an extra "Get Acrobat Reader" image that is loaded, that is not fetched via SSL (http://www.adobe.com/images/shared/download_buttons/get_flash_player.gif , instead of https://www.adobe.com/images/shared/download_buttons/get_flash_player.gif):
!ssl.jpg!
Even after installing Adobe Acrobat Reader, although the image disappears from the page, the image is apparently, still loaded (as observed in firebug), hence the issue:
!ssl2.jpg!

The same behavior is not exhibited in View Word macro / View PPT Macro / View Excel Macro.
fields.summary: View PDF Macro breaks SSL

fields.description:
# Create a new page in IE8.
# Add a large amount of content to the page, such that the editor window cannot contain all of it at once.\\I recommend copying a whole article from somewhere like http://alistapart.com
# Save the page.
# Edit the page again.
# Scroll half-way down the page.
# Select a single word from one of the paragraphs on the screen.
# Copy the content (via the keyboard shortcut).
# Click somewhere else in the paragraph, like next to the word.
# Paste.

The editor window jumps briefly, then settles with the line of content you just pasted sitting flush against the editor's bottom toolbar.

The reason I know that the cursor jumps as well is that if you now hit the Undo keyboard shortcut, the cursor will be at the start of the document. Indeed, if you position the cursor somewhere in the document before you copy and paste, the cursor seems to jump back there when you undo a paste action.
fields.summary: Editor cursor and scroll position "jumps" on first paste in IE8

fields.description:
During attachment migration between the database and the filesystem, the hibernate session gets very large very quickly, which makes the migration get slower and slower, as the autoflush check has to check more and more state to be removed.
The objects in the session include the attachment objects and the content (eg pages) to which the attachments are attached.
fields.summary: Attachment Migration stores too much in the hibernate session

h3. Summary of Bug

When a page is exported as PDF, special characters like Ω and µ are omitted.

h3. How to reproduce

# Create a page, and include special characters like Ω
# Save the page, and then 'Export as PDF'
# In the PDF file, the 'Ω' character is completely missing

h3. Findings

I have tried this in Confluence 4.0.3, 4.0, 3.5.9, 3.4.9, 3.3.3, 3.1.2 and 3.0.0_01. All of these versions suffer from the same problem. Have tried disabling and re-enabling the PDF Export plugin, then restart Confluence instance, but problem persists.

This is how it looks like in the editor :
!PDF export editor.png|thumbnail!

This is what happens after it is exported as PDF :
!PDF export result.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

Upload a font that contains these symbols to Confluence, as detailed in [CONF-25887|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25887].
fields.summary: PDF export omits special characters like µ and Ω

fields.description:
I often need to search a Confluence site to see where a specific macro parameter is used ---  in particular the name of a page used in 'include' and 'exerpt-include' macro.

In Confluence 3.5, I used to be able to do this by simply searching the name of my inclusion page in Confluence, which would list the inclusion page itself and all other pages containing 'include' and 'excerpt-include' pages that included/referenced this page (as a macro parameter).

For example:
* To search for all inclusion macros that include the page called "_QRG_Colour", I just entered the following text into the search box:
"include:_QRG_Colour"

This no longer works in Confluence 4.0, or at least I can't find a way of making it work. Please restore the functionality or document a workaround. It is essential for maintaining technical documentation.
fields.summary: Cannot do site-wide search for macro parameter values used on pages (in particular, the name of a page used in 'include' and 'exerpt-include' macro).

fields.description:
When testing migration of attachments from the database to the filesystem I get about 400 of the stacktrace below.  This is caused by a mismatch between the reported filesize in the attachment table and the actual length of the attachment.  The current behaviour is to log the error and skip the attachment.  However, I have checked some of the attachments and they are not actually broken.  It is (at least sometimes) the attachment table that is incorrect.

So really, Confluence should log a warning and migrate the data regardless.

Note, I'm not sure how old this bug is, but since it's definitely older than 4.0 I've put "3.5" as the affects version.

SQL to find a summary of the affected records:
{code:sql}
select count(*), attachments.filesize, avg(length(attachmentdata.data)), attachments.contenttype, attachments.attachment_comment, attachments.version
from attachments, attachmentdata
where attachments.attachmentid=attachmentdata.attachmentid and filesize != length(data)
group by attachments.filesize, attachments.contenttype, attachments.attachment_comment, attachments.version
{code}

Sample stacktrace
{noformat}
2011-10-19 14:57:02,346 ERROR [Long running task: Attachment data migration] [persistence.dao.hibernate.AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao$IntraHibernateAttachmentCopier] copy Could not copy attachment: Attachment: Marketing Pyramid v.2 (542867488) jon
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/admin/doeditattachmentstorage.action | url: /confluence/admin/doattachmentmigration.action | userName: dwillis.adm | action: doattachmentmigration
com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.AttachmentDataStreamSizeMismatchException: Attachment data stream contains a different number of bytes to the declared size of the attachment. Expected: 495, actual: 6514
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.writeStreamToFile(FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.java:241)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.saveDataForAttachment(FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.java:172)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.saveDataForAttachment(FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.java:132)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.hibernate.AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao$IntraHibernateAttachmentCopier.copy(AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao.java:448)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.hibernate.AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao$IntraHibernateAttachmentMigrator.migrate(AbstractHibernateAttachmentDao.java:503)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.AttachmentMigrationLongRunningTask$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(AttachmentMigrationLongRunningTask.java:71)
    at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
    at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.AttachmentMigrationLongRunningTask.runInternal(AttachmentMigrationLongRunningTask.java:66)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:21)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:35)
    at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Attachment Migration from database to filesystem fails due to filesize mismatch

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new page
# Add a line of text, like "lorem ipsum sit dolor amet". 
# Press 'enter' to start a new paragraph.
# From the menu, choose "Insert > Info" to create an info macro.
# Select the whole first paragraphs' text. You can achieve this either by triple-clicking the line, or by using the keyboard.
# Press 'Backspace'.

The line of text will be removed, and the cursor will disappear shortly afterwards.

The cursor will only disappear after the whole contents of the paragraph is removed via deleting a text selection; it does not happen when your cursor is collapsed.

This behaviour occurs at any level of nesting. Repeat the same steps above inside a macro body and the same result will occur.
fields.summary: Cursor disappears when selecting and deleting whole paragraph's contents above or below a macro

I suspect that this issue is a result of the resolution of CONF-23328, which while absolutely correct in relation to #links to the current page is not quite right when linking to the current page. If I create a comment which contains two links, one that links to the current page (in this case it was the Home page of the space) and another which links to a different page (note that both links contain a custom link body that retains the sense of where the links were originally pointing) {code}

{code} What's happening for me is that when I move a comment to a different page, then the first link points to the new 'current' page, when I would have expected it to remain pointing at the original Home page (the other link with the remains pointing at the page I selected) It's possible that I can work around this by inserting the tags manually as I move the comment, however I suspect that this edge case is also affecting the \{excerpt-include} macro, as can be seen by the following question on answers: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15521/excerpt-include-macro-and-links-with-anchors Ideally what I'd like to see is that if the link is to an anchor then the should be omitted, however if it has no anchor then the should be retained.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23741].
  {panel}

The old Confluence LDAP connector supports multi-valued fields.
The new LDAP connector does not and Confluence shoud regain that feature, as it helped really much in an organization where multiple userdirectores get combined into one big directory.

Here is an example of the LDAP fields where a user would have three different logins which all refer to the same identity:
CN=E01010101
Loginnames=user@domain.com
Loginnames=DOMAIN_A.USERNAME
Loginnames=DOMAIN_B.USERNAME

Groupmembership is searched via CN. Confluence searched the Loginnames field for checking the credentials and getting the comlpete DN for groupsearches (for instance: cn=E01010101,ou=users,dc=domain,dc=com).
Confluence 3.2.1 works very well with this setup, looking up the correct user information by CN.
Confluence 3.5.13 only finds user "Domain_B.USERNAME".
fields.summary: Multi Valued RDN for LDAP

fields.description:
h3.Problem

When creating a RSS feed using [RSS Feed Builder|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Using+the+RSS+Feed+Builder] the code generated doesn't work with the [RSS macro|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/RSS+Feed+Macro]. It returns a message informing *Page not permitted* even if the user indeed have permissions to see the content. See screen shot attached.

h3.Fix

There is none yet.

h3.Workaround
Adding the username and password to the feed URL, as described in this [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Adding+a+username+and+password+to+Confluence+RSS+feeds] makes it work, but the username and password are shown in text plain, which created a security concern and can make this workaround unfeasible.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23730].
  {panel}

I've found a couple of quick-win performance improvements that can be made to the General Configuration page in Confluence's admin console.

* GeneralConfigurationAction.getSiteHomePages is invoked on view operations, even though it's only needed on edit. This appears to be laziness on the part of webwork. Easy optimisation.

* GeneralConfigurationAction.getSiteHomePages performs at least 1, sometimes 2 individual permission checks on every single global space in the system. On systems with lots of spaces, this quickly fails to scale. The purpose of the permission check is to ensure that the Administrator is not able to set the site home page to a page that is not accessible to all users. This is a computationally expensive operation for small benefit. We could drastically improve the performance (with a slight usability cost) by changing the permission checking to occur 'on-save' rather than 'on-load', reducing the complexity of the operation from O\(n) to O(1).

* GeneralConfigurationAction.doDefault makes multiple calls to settingsManager.getGlobalSettings which involves a call to the BandanaManager each time. It should just retrieve the global settings once for the duration of the request.


h3. Patch
There is a patch available for Confluence 3.5.13 > 3.5.17. Please be aware that this is not tested and you use it at your own risk. The preferred fix for this issue is to upgrade to Confluence 4.1 or above.

Download the attached file ([CSP-68093-2.zip|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/91321/CSP-68093-2.zip]) and extract it into your Confluence's WEB-INF/classes directory, ensuring to preserve the folder paths in the zip file. At this point your WEB-INF/classes directory should contain this (in addition to what was there already):
{code}/WEB-INF
  /classes
    /com
      /atlassian
        /confluence
          /admin
            /actions
              GeneralConfigurationAction.class
              GeneralConfigurationAction-validation.xml{code}
You'll need to restart Confluence in order to pick up these changes, at which point your troubles will hopefully be gone! 

NB: This means it is now possible for an Administrator to accidentally set the site home page to a page that is not viewable by all users.
fields.summary: Performance improvements for /admin/viewgeneralconfig.action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23729].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# In IE, create a new page.
# Create a rich-text macro, such as \{info}.
# Inside the macro, type out a few words. Don't start a new paragraph.
# place your cursor between two words in your sentence.
# press enter.

The expected behaviour would be that everything to the right of the cursor is placed on a new line. What actually happens is the cursor moves, but the text stays in the single paragraph.

Furthermore, if you place additional content on that single paragraph (perhaps you backspace a paragraph in to it), that text will be trapped inside that paragraph, too.

This only seems to occur with rich-text macro bodies. Plain-text macros such as the code block do not exhibit this behaviour.
fields.summary: First paragraph of a macro in IE traps your macro's body text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23727].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
find a page to share
click the share button
paste an email into the autocomplete field and press space before the autocomplete has a chance to suggest any values
delete the space, auto complete will not suggest a value to add
retype the email into the share box, auto complete will not suggest a value to add

This is not limited to pasting an email, can reproduce this by typing an email if you pause after typing the full email and then press a space.  

I can reproduce this on EAC, may need to slow the process down if running locally.

To work around this, refresh the page that you want to share, and do not put any whitespace after the email address in the autocomplete field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23720].
  {panel}

When browsing Confluence, larger images can slow the loading of pages and make Confluence feel sluggish.  In order to combat this, users will edit images in a desktop application to reduce file size before imbedding the image in a Confluence page.

What we would like to see is the option to have Confluence do the compression for us as the image is uploaded.  An analogous situation would be how a smart phone will reduce the resolution of a picture before being sent in a text message.  Below are potential features we would like to see.

-The option to set a maximum KB size for images and automatically edit images to fit this requirement upon upload
-The option to have the compressed image displayed on the page but still have the original image available for download

The ultimate goal being to reduce the complexity of making sure images on pages do not slow the Confluence end user experience.

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Cheers,
Andrew Campbell
Atlassian Support, San Francisco
fields.summary: Compress images when uploading to Confluence
